content.question: Let a n = 1 n ln n for n ≥ 3. (a) Let f be the function given by f ( x ) = 1 x ln x . For x   ≥  3 , f is continuous, decreasing, and positive. Use the integral test to show that ∑ n = 3 ∞ a n diverges.

frqParts.text: Let a n = 1 n ln n for n ≥ 3. (a) Let f be the function given by f ( x ) = 1 x ln x . For x   ≥  3 , f is continuous, decreasing, and positive. Use the integral test to show that ∑ n = 3 ∞ a n diverges.

(b) Consider the infinite series <math> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <munderover> <mo>∑</mo> <mrow> <mi>n</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <mi>∞</mi> </munderover> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>n</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle> <msub> <mi>a</mi> <mi>n</mi> </msub> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mi>ln</mi> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mi>ln</mi> <mn>4</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <mn>5</mn> <mi>ln</mi> <mn>5</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>−</mo> <mo>⋯</mo> </mrow> </math>. Identify properties of this series that guarantee the series converges. Explain why the sum of this series is less than <math> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> </math>.

(c) Find the interval of convergence of the power series <math> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <munderover> <mo>∑</mo> <mrow> <mi>n</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <mi>∞</mi> </munderover> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>n</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>n</mi> <mi>ln</mi> <mi>n</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> </math>. Show the analysis that leads to your answer.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
